description: Independent Ballot Verification Application for Electors with Visual Impairments
full_summary:
===============

### Assistive Voting Technology Development (AVTD) Tender

#### Background
Elections Canada, an agency of the Canadian Parliament, is responsible for conducting federal elections and referendums. As a federal institution, Elections Canada must comply with the Accessible Canada Act to remove barriers to voting. To meet this requirement, Elections Canada seeks to develop an assistive voting technology application for electors with visual impairments.

#### Project Requirements
The successful bidder will design, build, deliver, and maintain a mobile application that enables visually impaired and blind electors to verify the mark on their ballot using their own device. The application must be a standalone (native) mobile application.

#### Security Requirements
The mobile application must meet minimum corporate security requirements for reliability on a single device. Resources must also be reliable.

#### Contract Period
The contract period will commence from the contract's effective date until December 31, 2024. The Contractor will have an option to extend the contract by 12 additional months.

#### Tender Submission
Bidders can submit proposals electronically using the epost Connect service by Canada Post Corporation. Proposals must be delivered, sealed, to the Proposal Receiving Unit by the closing date and time indicated on the front page of the RFP.

#### Selection Methodology
The tender will be evaluated based on a combined rating of technical merit and price.

#### Trade Agreements
This tender is restricted to Canadian suppliers and is subject to the Canada-United States-Mexico Agreement (CUSMA) and the Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA).

#### Contact Information
Bidders must direct all enquiries to Sufia Fuentes, Senior Consultant, at proposition-proposal@elections.ca. Important information can be found on the contract awarded.
